title: Royal® Partners with Major League Cricket to Sample Authentic South Asian Cuisine
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC), the premier professional cricket league in North America, has selected Dallas to host this year’s championship game. This decision underscores Dallas's growing reputation as a hub for cricket enthusiasts and professionals. With its state-of-the-art facilities and vibrant community support, Dallas offers an unparalleled environment for players and fans to experience the excitement of live cricket at its best — a testament to the city's commitment to fostering diverse sporting experiences and creating lasting cultural connections.

Adding to the excitement, MLC has partnered with Royal®, recognized as the #1 brand of Authentic Basmati rice in America. This collaboration highlights cricket's cultural significance and celebrates the diverse culinary heritage that Royal represents. As fans gather to watch thrilling matches, they will also have the opportunity to enjoy the flavors of Royal, enriching their experience both on and off the field.

Royal Brings ‘The Many Flavors of You’ to Dallas this MLC Season with authentic flavors and tastes that consumers love with experiential activations at stadium matches, social media giveaways, player engagement, and other initiatives to engage current fans and introduce new individuals to the sport.

title: Seattle Orcas close out season falling to Super Kings by 37 runs
body:
When the first season of Major League Cricket came to a close, the Seattle Orcas showed their class. This year, the result was much different for the team of the Pacific Northwest.

Seattle fell in its final match of MLC 2 to the Texas Super Kings, losing by 37 runs.

It capped a horrid season for the green and gray, as the Orcas managed just two points and finished at the bottom of the table.

Seattle is very South African heavy with its international players, who are coming off a world cup semifinal appearance. To say there were tired legs, would be stating the obvious. “Most of our pros came over straight from the world cup. Even if they won’t agree, they looked a little bit exhausted,” said Orcas All-Rounder Harmeet Singh.

Some of the best South African cricketers have been playing without more than a week’s break for over four months.

This season just wasn’t to be for the Orcas. Like Seattle’s other bat-to-ball franchise, the Mariners, the Orcas could not put consistent runs on the board.

Over the course of the seven games played this season, Seattle batted second in three of them and chased runs successfully in their lone victory. But when the Orcas were required to put up a high number, Seattle continuously dropped the ball.

When opening with the batting, the Orcas have won just one game in their two years of existence. It was all the way back on July 15, 2023, in a win over San Fransisco. But since then, Seattle has lost seven in a row when opening with the paddle.

Despite quite literally nothing bouncing the way of the Orcas in year two, in the final match there looked to be some positives. Ayan Desai made his MLC and Orcas debut taking the ball to start the first over.

With his first ball he took the wicket of a top-class cricketer in Devon Conway via leg before wicket. That ball was later named the play of the game and was the start of a great first match for Desai.

He finished with 2 wickets and 30 runs, and an economy of 7.50 which was the third lowest of all bowlers in the game.

It was just a bleak day with the bat for the Orcas after holding the Super Kings to a pretty manageable 177 after the first innings.

Seattle knew it was going to have to work hard after its top run-scorer Ryan Rickleton was dismissed for a golden duck for the second straight match. Rickleton looked to be the bright spot of the Orca’s 2024 season scoring a century and spent a lot of time on the top of the run scoring table, but in his last two matches never saw a second ball.

No Orca scored more than 26 runs (Quentin de Kock 19 balls), which pales in comparison to the Super Kings’ three players who scored over 29 in the match.

It is a season to forget based on results for the Orcas, but MLC season 2 is a year to look back on as the sport of cricket continues to grow in the United States.

WASHINGTON FREEDOM FORM: GETTING BACK TO WINNING WAYS A PRORITY

Washington Freedom come into the play-offs on the back of defeat, losing their unbeaten record in this tournament at the hands of the Unicorns. Although the result meant nothing in the grand scheme of things, Washington will hope for no psychological effects.

LAST THREE: LWW

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS FORM: WANTING TO AT LEAST FINISH ON A HIGH

To beat Washington Freedom earlier in the week and extending their winning run will have served this San Francisco Unicorns squad with a huge injection of confidence ahead of this qualifier, knowing they have the ability to beat their opponents here.

LAST THREE: WWW

WASHINGTON FREEDOM BETTING ANALYSIS

Openers Travis Head and Steve Smith have combined for a total of 385 runs over the course of this tournament, with Head blasting 194 and Smith 191. The latter is averaging over 60 and such numbers cannot be ignored from a betting point of view. Back Smith to score over 30+ runs and also back the pair to add over 26.5 runs for the first Washington wicket.

Whilst he is known mainly for his batting, Rachin Ravindra also provides a very handy spin option for the Freedom. Figures of 4/16 against Texas Super Kings is testament to that and any hint of turn at Grand Prairie Stadium will be taken advantage of by the New Zealand international. Therefore, look at backing Ravindra with a small stake to finish as Washington’s top bowler.

SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS BETTING ANALYSIS

A lot could depend on San Francisco opener Finn Allen in the qualifier as he possesses the power required to tip things in the Unicorn’s favour whether they be setting or chasing a target. Allen’s 186 runs, including 15 sixes have been paramount to his side’s success, so backing Allen to continue his big-hitting exploits and gain over 0.5 match sixes here is worth a play on.

Also worthy of attention on the batting front is Sanjay Krishnamurthi on the back of his 79 from just 42 balls in the last contest between these two sides. Having performed so well against the same opponent so recently, Krishnamurthi knows what he needs to do to accumulate a significant score again vs Washington and backing him to gain 20+ runs via the ‘Battle Milestones’ market should be considered.

WASHINGTON FREEDOM VS SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS EXPERTPREDICTION

San Francisco Unicorns may have gotten the better of Washington Freedom when the two teams last collided, but you can be sure that a different Freedom will be on show this time around, with significantly more at stake. The bowling especially should be far tighter on the Washington side and San Francisco will surely not find it as easy to score on this occasion.

Expect Washington to bounce back strongly and whilst their batters should get on top of the Unicorns, this time the Freedom bowlers will likely show a marked improvement and help lead the league stage table toppers to victory.

title: Steve Smith’s Amazing Performance in Major League Cricket 2024
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 is seeing a superb season for Australian cricketer Steve Smith, who was recently seen as the king of cricket grounds. Smith has not had a place in the Australian T20I team but showed his prowess with the bat again and became the talk of the town on Monday, July 22. Washington Freedom’s team leader provided bowling skills at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas against the San Francisco Unicorns, proving his unerring style even in the modern mode of the game.

The test specialist Steve Smith gave a rude reminder of that by cutting loose against the bowlers for 56 of 31 balls. He also set five boundaries and four maximums, two of which were stunning and caught the attention of MLC’s social media team. That flexibility alone was on display in the dressing-room speech, reminding everyone why he is widely considered one of cricket’s premier players of all time.

Great Figures in MLC 2024

Since the start of the season, Steve Smith has proved to be one of the best players for the Washington Freedom. He has 247 runs to his credit in the seven games and has scored an average of 61.75. with a magnificent strike rate of 144.44. These figures put him in the position of the principal run-maker in the competition, a position next to Faf du Plessis, who has amassed 264 runs, and his teammate Travis Head, who has scored 250 runs.

Smith and his valuable properties have played a significant role in the Washington Freedom’s campaign to attain and maintain a solid standing in leagues.

The Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns will face each other once more on Friday in the first semifinal of the tournament. Both teams qualified for the playoffs with five equal wins; therefore, the following match was expected. Even with the six-wicket loss to San Francisco in the recent match that adopted the DLS method in Washington’s first match defeat of the season, the side is fully optimistic, and Smith has a lot of trust in them.

Steve Smith’s Journey and Revival in MLC

What is perhaps even more powerful is that this journey in MLC 2024 has been told through the story of Smith. He has experienced some misfortune in the international T20 chase, and then this spec allows him to reintroduce himself. This characteristic has been a boost to Washington Freedom because he can stabilize the innings and yet be very aggressive when the game calls for it. This season, Steve Smith has not only shown good technique but also the good strategies that you expect from a captain and a leader of the team.

However, a noteworthy aspect of Steve Smith is his captaincy for the Washington Freedom, besides the batting. This is because he has been around, and he is the one who uses his maturity in dealing with the team when it is steamed up. The young players within the team have thus greatly benefited from him, and Washington has become one of the most balanced and charged teams in the tournament.

Everybody will focus on the performance of Steve Smith in Major League Cricket 2024 as the competition goes on. His comeback to T20 cricket is a sign of versatility and the ambition of the player seeking to be the best. Looking at the coming rounds of matches and the knockout stages, especially, Steve Smith and his ability to lead the team will be very vital to the success of the Washington Freedom.

In any case, the MLC 2024 season alone is more than enough to establish Steve Smith as the most prominent cricketer of the current and perhaps future generations, thereby expressing that class and quality in the cricket field do not have an expiration date at the international level.

title: Five consecutive 50s for Travis Head in MLC 2024: Aussie opener lighting up Major League Cricket playoffs
body:
Travis Head has been in outstanding form during the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) season, scoring five consecutive half-centuries. The Australian opener has maintained a striking rate of 175

In the most recent qualifier match against the San Francisco Unicorns, Head played a stellar innings, scoring an unbeaten 77 off 44 balls. His performance included 10 fours and three sixes, which helped securing a seven-wicket victory for Washington Freedom.

What happened in the Washington's Freedom match against San Francisco Unicorns?

In the qualifier match at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, The San Francisco Unicorns, after being invited to bat first, had a disastrous start, losing four wickets before reaching the 50-run mark.

Marco Jansen struck early, dismissing players Finn Allen and Josh Inglis. Rachin Ravindra's exceptional bowling (4/11) further dismantled the Unicorns, who were bowled out for 145.

BET NOW: Exclusive sign-up offers and bonuses when you bet on sporting action

Chasing the target, Washington Freedom lost Steve Smith early, but Travis Head's aggressive batting turned the game around. Head scored 31 runs off Carmi le Roux’s two overs and another 13 off Haris Rauf, helping Washington reach 52/1 by the end of the powerplay.

Despite a few setbacks, with Andries Gous and Rachin Ravindra getting out cheaply, Head’s solid partnership with Glenn Maxwell (54 off 23 balls) ensured the team crossed the 100-run mark by the 13th over. The duo's partnership led Washington to victory in just 16 overs.

title: Faf du Plessis Leads Texas Super Kings to Victory Over MI New York in Major League Cricket Eliminator
body:
Faf du Plessis led the Texas Super Kings to a decisive nine-wickets victory over MI New York in the major league cricket Eliminator match, with strong performances from key players driving the win.

By the Numbers

Texas Super Kings achieved 167/1 in 18.3 overs to chase down a target of 164.

Faf du Plessis scored 72 off 47 balls, with Devon Conway's unbeaten 51 off 43 deliveries contributing significantly to the victory.

Faf de Plessis, the player of the match, hit three sixes and six fours in his innings.

Yes, But

MI New York showed resilience with partnerships and some aggressive batting, but ultimately fell short against a dominant Texas Super Kings side.

State of Play

Texas Super Kings displayed a powerful batting performance, securing a comfortable win with a solid partnership between Conway and Hardie.

MI New York struggled after losing early wickets, despite efforts from players like Monank Patel and Rashid Khan to stabilize the innings.

Faf du Plessis' captaincy and key contributions with the bat were instrumental in Texas Super Kings' success.

What's Next

Following this victory, Texas Super Kings advance in the major league cricket tournament, positioning themselves as strong contenders for the title with their impressive form.

Bottom Line

Faf du Plessis' leadership and stellar performance, combined with a cohesive team effort, propelled Texas Super Kings to a remarkable win, setting a high standard for their future games in the tournament.

title: Injured Coetzee replaced by Pretorius for WI tour
body:
(CMC) – Injury has put paceman Gerald Coetzee out of South Africa’s two-Test tour of the Caribbean next month.

The 23-year-old, who has featured in three Tests since making his debut last year against the West Indies, sustained a left-side strain while turning out in the ongoing Major League Cricket tournament in the United States.

Migael Pretorius, an uncapped 29-year-old speedster, has been named as Coetzee’s replacement for the August 7-19 series in Trinidad and Tobago and Guyana.

“Coetzee sustained the injury while playing for Texas Super Kings in Major League Cricket earlier this month,” a statement from Cricket South Africa said.

“He then returned home and underwent further assessments by the Proteas medical team and has subsequently not been medically cleared to take part in the tour.”

Coetzee toured the Caribbean last May for the three-match Twenty20 series in Jamaica, featuring in two games.

He was also a key component in his side’s attack when the West Indies toured South Africa for two Tests last year, picking up nine wickets.

Pretorius, meanwhile, has been in good form for Somerset in the English County Championship, where he has taken 23 wickets for eight games.

West Indies face South Africa in the opening Test from August 7-11 before locking horns again in the series finale from August 15-19.

SA Squad: Temba Bavuma (captain), David Bedingham, Matthew Breetzke, Nandre Burger, Tony de Zorzi, Keshav Maharaj, Aiden Markram, Wiaan Mulder, Lungi Ngidi, Dane Paterson, Dane Piedt, Migael Pretorius, Kagiso Rabada, Ryan Rickelton, Tristan Stubbs, and Kyle Verreynne.

title: Watch: Rashid Khan recreates MS Dhoni shots during fiery knock in MLC 2024
body:
Rashid Khan played a wonderful knock, recreating the iconic shots of MS Dhoni in in MI New York's eliminator encounter against Texas Super Kings (TSK) in the ongoing Major League Cricket 2024.

New Delhi: Legendary Afghanistan cricketer Rashid Khan displayed his batting prowess in MI New York’s eliminator encounter against Texas Super Kings (TSK) in the ongoing Major League Cricket 2024 season. The Faf du Plessis-led Super Kings swept aside MI New York by nine wickets to seal a spot in the qualifier 2.

However, Rashid, in MI’s disappointing show, stood out with his exemplary show hammering a sensational knock of 55 to get his side out of trouble for some time. After put into bat first, MI were off to a shaky start losing early wickets but the team did a fantastic job to promote Rashid up the order which proved to be a masterstroke. He smashed 55 runs to power them to a respectable total.

The Afghanistan star, enroute his special knock, showcased glimpses of AB de Villiers and Mahendra Singh Dhoni, playing few shots similar to how the veteran cricketers’ played. He took only 30 balls to smash his blistering knock, which was studded with four boundaries and as many sixes. In his innings, he played several beautiful shots but his aerial shot over the backward point and a helicopter shot mesmerised everyone, which was akin to de Villiers and Dhoni.

Here’s the video

Besides putting up a memorable batting show, Rashid also had a good day with the ball, conceding 22 runs off his four overs. However, his valiant all-round effort went in vain, with TSK chasing the 164-run target easily, riding on clinical fifties from Devon Conway and Faf du Plessis.

title: Glenn Maxwell smashes audacious 103-metre six in MLC 2024 – Watch
body:
Aussie sensation Glenn Maxwell smashed a monstrous six in the Qualifier 1 match of the Major League Cricket 2024 in Dallas.

New Delhi: While he’s on the field, he never ceases to amaze the audience. Glenn Maxwell, considered as one of the fiercest players in world cricket, always lives by the expectations and continues to entertain the crowd. The hard-hitting batter was on a six-hitting spree in the Qualifier 1 match of the Major League Cricket 2024 in Dallas on Friday.

In the contest between San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom for a place in the final, Maxwell smashed as many as five sixes enroute to his fiery half-century for the Washington side. The lethal Aussie batter remained unbeaten on 54 off just 23 balls, which helped his side pull off an easy 146-run target in just 15.3 overs with seven wickets in hand.

Maxwell’s audacious hit

Among his insane hitting, a maximum he smashed off Pakistan bowler Hassan Khan gained a lot of attraction in the crowd. In the 15th over of the innings, Maxwell hit a monstrous 103-metre six, picking up a fullish tossed-up delivery by the left-arm spinner. The shot went high up in the air and cleared the boundary rope landing somewhere in between the crowd.

Watch the six here

Apart from Maxwell’s match-winning knock, the hero of the ODI World Cup final 2023 and another lethal Aussie player Travis Head also stood out with a special knock. Head smashed 77 runs in just 44 balls to help his side gain an easy victory and storm into the final. Washington will now wait for the winner of the Challenger, where San Francisco Unicorns will go up against Texas Super Kings in a do-or-die affair.

title: Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate joins India team ahead of Sri Lanka series: The Dutchman's coaching experience alongside Gautam Gambhir detailed
body:
Former Netherlands international, Ryan ten Doeschate was earlier appointed as the new assistant coach of the Indian cricket team as a part of head coach Gautam Gambhir's support staff.

Ahead of the India's 3-match T20I series against Sri Lanka, he was pictured in a training session with the players at Pallekele.

Ten Doeschate, who was part of the support staff of the LA Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket in the USA joined up with the Indian squad on Thursday, July 25.

BET NOW: Exclusive sign-up offers and bonuses when you bet on IND vs SL T20I cricket action

Why did India head coach Gautam Gambhir include Ryan ten Doeschate as a part of his support staff?

Gautam Gambhir's working association with the new Indian assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate goes back many years ago, when they were teammates at the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in the Indian Premier League (IPL).

The former Netherlands batsman, infact, had played under the captaincy of Gambhir at KKR for five seasons, between 2011 and 2015.

Moreover, Ten Doeschate also involved with KKR as a part of their coaching setup in the 2024 IPL season when Gambhir was their mentor, when the team went to become champions for the third time.

Apart from Ten Doeschate, Gambhir has also picked Abhishek Nayar as the other assistant coach, who was also involved with the Kolkata franchise last season.

During a press conference ahead of the T20I series, Gambhir discussed about the nature of their roles as assistant coaches of the Indian team.

Ten Doeschate and Nayar while primarily known for their batting, were also decent allrounders during their playing career. Therefore, Gambhir believes that both individuals will have a role to play in all departments.

"I have worked with people like Abhishek Nayar, Ryan Ten Doeschate very closely. In the last two months, especially in the IPL, I have enjoyed working with them. They are thorough professionals. Hope Ryan and Abhishek can have a successful stint. Hopefully, we can have a successful tenure as coaches. I am really looking forward to working with the rest of the other guys as well" Gambhir said.

"They (BCCI) have agreed to most of the things I have asked for. Abhishek and Ryan as assistant coaches are going to be the crux of the support staff. I personally feel they could be assistant coaches, who can involve themselves more in all three departments rather than just one. That’s the reason we now have two assistant coaches. As I said, we still have one month after the Sri Lanka tour. We will try and finalise after the Sri Lanka tour," he added.

According to Cricbuzz reports, former South Africa international, Morne Morkel, who has also been a part of KKR in the past, is a heavy favourite to be included in India's coaching setup as the bowling coach. Gambhir has worked with Morkel in the past, as a part of the Lucknow Super Giants franchise.

MORE: When will Morne Morkel join up with the Indian team as the new bowling coach?

title: South Africa pacer Gerald Coetzee ruled out of Test series against West Indies
body:
South Africa's fast bowler Gerald Coetzee has been ruled out of the upcoming Test series against West Indies. He sustained a side strain during the ongoing edition of Major League Cricket (MLC), USA's T20 franchise league, while playing for Texas Super Kings (TSK) and has already returned home midway through the tournament.

He is currently being assessed by South Africa's medical team and accordingly, a decision on his recovery and comeback will be taken. Migael Pretorius has been named his replacement and might even end up making his debut during the series against the West Indies. He has featured in 64 first-class matches in his career so far and was picked in the T20I squad three years ago but he didn't get a chance.

Pretorius has picked up 188 wickets in red-ball cricket so far at an average of 27.5 and is also the leading wicket-taker for Somerset in the ongoing County Championship in England accounting for 23 scalps. South Africa's tour of the West Indies will get underway from August 7 at Port of Spain in Trinidad before the action moves to Providence Stadium in Guyana for the second Test starting from August 15.

The three-match T20I series will follow the Tests as the two teams will lock horns in the shortest format from August 23 to 27.

title: Injured South Africa Speedster Gerald Coetzee To Miss West Indies Tour
body:
South Africa speedster Gerald Coetzee has been ruled out of next month’s two-match Test series against West Indies due to a left side strain.

Cricket South Africa on Thursday announced that the 23-year-old sustained the injury while playing for Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket earlier this month.

After returning to South Africa for further evaluation by the Proteas medical teamhe has subsequently not been medically cleared to take part in the tour, which begins on August 7.

Meanwhile, North-West Dragons fast bowler Migael Pretorius has been named as his replacement. The uncapped Pretorius returns to the Test setup for the first time, although he was previously called up for the series against Sri Lanka back in 2020.

The 29-year-old has an overall first-class wicket tally of 188, with his most recent red-ball outings garnering 23 wickets in eight matches for Somerset in the ongoing County Championship in England.

With more than nine years of domestic circuit experience, Pretorius has scalped 188 wickets in 64 first-class matches.

Temba Bavuma will be leading the 16-member squad in the series which begins on August 7 in Trinidad as confirmed by their red-ball coach Shukri Conrad.

The opening match will be held from August 7 to 11 at Queen’s Park Oval in Trinidad and Tobago while the second Test will take place in Guyana from August 15 to 19.

Updated South Africa squad: Temba Bavuma (captain), David Bedingham, Matthew Breetzke, Nandre Burger, Tony de Zorzi, Keshav Maharaj, Aiden Markram, Wiaan Mulder, Lungi Ngidi, Dane Paterson, Dane Piedt, Migael Pretorius, Kagiso Rabada, Ryan Rickelton, Tristan Stubbs and Kyle Verreynne.

title: Gautam Gambhir's old ally and India's new assistant coach joins squad in Sri Lanka: Welcome Ryan ten Doeschate
body:
While all the cricketers and the support staff members flew together from Mumbai, ten Doeschate, who was in the US as part of the support staff at the LA Knight Riders in the Major League Cricket, flew directly to Colombo and then joined the Indian squad in Pallekele on Thursday (July 25).

The first India vs Sri Lanka T20I will be played on Saturday (July 27).

Nayar and Ten Doeschate have long associations with Gambhir. All three were part of the Kolkata Knight Riders coaching staff in IPL 2024. Gambhir was the mentor, Nayar the assistant coach, and Ten Doeschate was designated as the team's fielding coach. The former Netherlands star, in fact, played five seasons under Gambhir's captaincy in KKR. Between 2011 and 2015, ten Doeschate featured in 41 matches for KKR. He was inducted into the three-time champions' support staff even before Gambhir came on board for the last season.

This is the first time the Indian cricket setup is seeing two assistant coaches. Notably, there was no such post during Anil Kumble, Ravi Shastri or Rahul Dravid's tenures. There was a batting coach, a bowling coach, a fielding coach and other support staff members comprising throwdown specialists, physios, analysts and others.

Things are slightly different in Gambhir's tenure, at least as things stand now. He has appointed two assistant coaches in Nayar and ten Doeschate. There are no mentions of a batting coach. T Dilip, Inda's fielding coach during Dravid's tenure, has got an extension. Regarding the bowling coach, NCA coach Sairaj Bahutule is in Sri Lanka as a stop-gap arrangement. There are reports of Gambhir showing interest in getting former South Africa pacer Morne Morkel, another old associate of the former India opener, on board.

There are no official announcements from the BCCI regarding Gambhir's support staff, but it will likely come after the Sri Lanka tour.

Gambhir eager to work with Nayar and ten Doeschate

“Really happy with the BCCI. They have agreed to most of the things I have asked for. I was really surprised when I was reading all the news. Abhishek, as assistant coach, Ryan, as assistant coach. I feel there could be assistant coaches working and focussing on all three departments rather than one specific department. That's the reason we now have two assistant coaches. That's the way we will go forward as well. Yes, we will get to know the exact support staff after the Sri Lanka tour,” Gambhir said.

Gambhir spoke about his experience of working with Nayar and Ten Doeschate in KKR earlier this season when the franchise lifted their third IPL title. “This is going to be the crux of the support staff. As I said, we still have one month after the Sri Lanka tour. We will try and finalise after the Sri Lanka tour. But, I have worked with people like Abhishek Nayar, Ryan ten Doeschate very closely. In the last two months, especially in the IPL, I have enjoyed working with them. They are thorough professionals. Hope Ryan and Abhishek can have a successful stint. Hopefully, we can have a successful tenure as coaches. I am really looking forward to work with the rest of the other guys as well. I have had some really good feedback from the players about the other guys. I am really looking forward to working with them,” he said.

title: Injured Coetzee ruled out of Proteas' series against West Indies
body:
JOHANNESBURG - Proteas fast bowler Gerald Coetzee will miss the upcoming Test series in the West Indies due to injury.

The 23-year-old was ruled out on Thursday, a day before the team’s departure for the Caribbean, due to a left side strain.

Coetzee was playing for the Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket competition, in the United States, when he sustained the injury earlier in July.

The Proteas medical team was unable to clear him to play again after further assessments when he returned home. His place in the 16-man touring squad will be taken by uncapped North West Dragons fast bowler, Migael Pretorius.

Pretorius is not a newcomer to the group and returns to the Test setup for the first time since his maiden call-up in December 2020 for the series against Sri Lanka.

The 29-year-old has an overall first-class wicket tally of 188 and produced stellar performances in the County Championship in England, where he picked up 23 wickets in eight matches for Somerset.

title: MLC 2024: Washington Freedom Maintain Winning Streak to Stay at Top Following 42-run Win over Texas Super Kings
body:
Dallas [US], July 20 (ANI): The Washington Freedom maintained their winning streak to stay on top of the Major League Cricket points table with a comfortable 42-run victory over the Texas Super Kings.

The Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas witnessed a remarkable performance, as Rachin Ravindra's four wickets helped bowl out the Texan team for 164 runs. Led by Faf du Plessis' quickfire fifty, the fastest by a batter this season, the Texas Super Kings had a strong start to their run-chase.

Also Read | QPR vs Tottenham Hotspur, Club Friendly 2024 Live Streaming Online in India: How To Watch Pre-Season Football Match Live Telecast on TV & Football Score Updates in IST?.

The Proteas opener propelled his team to 76 runs in the powerplay. However, Washington's bowlers executed a brilliant comeback in the middle overs. Jasdeep Singh, Glenn Maxwell, and Ravindra shared the 10 wickets among them, but it was Lockie Ferguson's crucial over to Du Plessis after the powerplay that turned the tide. Lockie conceded only 2 wides in that over, eventually leading to Faf's dismissal.

Soon after, the Super Kings' batting lineup crumbled, losing 4 wickets for just 15 runs between overs 7.1 and 11.6, ultimately costing them the match. While Calvin Savage managed to strike a few powerful blows towards the end, it only served to narrow the margin of defeat.

Also Read | Rangers vs Manchester United, Club Friendly 2024 Live Streaming Online in India: How To Watch Pre-Season Football Match Live Telecast on TV & Football Score Updates in IST?.

Earlier, Washington Freedom posted a formidable target of 206 for the Texas Super Kings. The fireworks began early, with Travis Head delivering a scintillating performance in the powerplay. He hammered 53 runs off just 22 balls, dismantling the seamers with ease and giving Washington a flying start.

As spin was introduced, the scoring rate slowed slightly, thanks to some purchase on the used pitch. However, Maxwell played a pivotal role in maintaining the momentum, contributing crucial runs in the middle overs. Towards the tail end of the innings, Pienaar provided a valuable boost, ensuring a strong finish for the team.

Meanwhile, Steve Smith (57) also continued his consistent performances, nearly batting through the entire innings and securing a well-earned fifty. His steady presence at the crease anchored the Washington innings and kept the scoreboard ticking.

The start given by the two Australian batters was more than enough for the middle order of the Washington-based side to take on the rest of the bowlers. Maxwell (34) and Obus Pienaar (33) both scored crucial runs to ensure their team put up a tough target that the Texas Super Kings were eventually unable to chase down.

Brief Scores: Washington Freedom 206/5 (Steve Smith 57, Travis Head 53, Noor Ahmad 3/38) vs Texas Super Kings 164 (Faf du Plessis 55, Calvin Savage 35, Rachin Ravindra 4/16). (ANI)

title: GT20 Canada Live telecast: When and where to watch Global T20 League 2024 on TV and streaming in India?
body:
Global T20 Canada, one of the umpteen T20 leagues in the world is set to commence on Thursday, July 25 with all the matches set to take place in Brampton, Ontario. With the Major League Cricket (MLC) in its final stages with just three matches remaining, and the Hundred having begun a couple of days ago, GT20 Canada is another addition in the already populated July-August window, with the Caribbean Premier League to follow at the end of next month.

The fourth edition of the Global T20 Canada has been able to attract some of the biggest names in T20 cricket including the likes of David Warner, Sunil Narine, Marcus Stoinis, Mohammad Amir, Chris Lynn, Carlos Brathwaite, Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Rassie van der Dussen. The withdrawal of the Pakistan trio of Babar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan and Shaheen Afridi will be a dampener, especially for the Pakistan fans. However, with the players from USA and Canada forming a local connection, the current edition of the tournament is set to be a cracking one.

Like the Hundred, a few teams will miss their marquee players who are playing in the Hundred playoffs but other than that, the short 17-day tournament promises to be an exhilarating ride.

When and where to watch Global T20 Canada League on TV and OTT in India?

The Global T20 Canada matches will have a 1:30 AM IST start on the next day of the scheduled matchday as per local time. On double-header days, the matches will have an 8:30 PM IST start on the scheduled matchday and a 1:30 AM start for the second game on the next day. Only the second qualifier and the final are scheduled for a 9:30PM IST start.

The Hundred men and women's competitions will be broadcast live on TV through Star Sports Network while the live streaming will be available on the Fancode app and website.

body:

On Thursday, Texas Super Kings will face MI New York in the much-anticipated eliminator clash of the ongoing Major League Cricket. The high-octane clash is scheduled at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

TEX vs NY: Team Previews

Texas Super Kings

Led by Faf du Plessis, Texas Super Kings have had a topsy-turvy journey in the Major League Cricket, occupying the third position in the six-team standings with three wins in seven outings.

Skipper Du Plessis has been the most significant contributor in the batting department, while New Zealand's Devon Conway being the second-best with 180 runs in six matches.

However, the Super Kings would want better returns from their bowlers, who have mostly failed to strike at crucial junctures.

Zia-ul-Haq and Marcus Stoinis have scalped six wickets each, while Noor Ahmad has showcased his mettle, picking up five wickets in two outings.

MI New York

Pollard and Pooran will be key players for MINY [X]

On the other hand, MI New York had a disastrous run in the first half of the competition, losing four of their first six matches.

However, riding on a heroic knock from skipper Kieron Pollard, MI finally broke their losing streak and entered the playoffs with a four-wicket victory over Los Angeles Knight Riders.

Marquee overseas players Rashid Khan and Trent Boult have been exceptional with the ball, while Nicholas Pooran has emerged as MI's wrecker-in-chief with the bat, scoring 172 runs in six games.

However, the fact that Rashid Khan is MI's second-highest run-getter highlights their collective failure as a batting unit.

So, moving on to this must-win game, MI New York would like better performances from their batters- particularly Dewald Brevis.

The surface at Grand Prairie Stadium will offer minimal seam movement to the fast bowlers. However, the pacers might succeed with their change-ups as it's the 13th MLC 2024 game at this venue.

title: Washington Freedom Triumphs Over San Francisco Unicorns to Secure MLC Final Spot
body:
Washington Freedom registered an emphatic 7-wicket win over the San Francisco Unicorns in the Qualifier of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Thursday, securing their spot in the final. Rachin Ravindra's stellar bowling figures of 4/11 played a crucial role in restricting the Unicorns to 145 runs.

Travis Head (77* off 44) and Glenn Maxwell (54* off 23) remained unbeaten, guiding Washington to chase down the target in just 16 overs. Despite an early breakthrough from Pat Cummins, who dismissed Steve Smith and bowled a maiden over, the Unicorns couldn't maintain the momentum as Carmi le Roux and Haris Rauf failed to contain Head's explosive batting.

The San Francisco Unicorns had a dismal start, losing four wickets before reaching the 50-run mark. Marco Jansen and Saurabh Netravalkar provided early breakthroughs, supported by Ravindra's critical wicket of Sanjay Krishnamurthi. Despite a half-century from Hassan Khan, the Unicorns managed only 145 runs. Washington's comprehensive win places them in the MLC final, while the Unicorns will compete against Texas Super Kings for a spot in the summit clash.

(With inputs from agencies.)

title: WATCH: Pat Cummins dismisses Steve Smith on the very first ball of his spell in MLC 2024
body:
In a thrilling qualifier match of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024, Washington Freedom emerged victorious against the San Francisco Unicorns, thanks to stellar performances by Travis Head and Marco Jansen. With this victory, Washington Freedom have secured their place as the first finalist of the MLC 2024.

Pat Cummins dismisses Steve Smith

Pat Cummins, often dubbed the ‘Golden Boy,’ delivered a crucial moment in the game by dismissing Steve Smith in an uncharacteristic fashion. Smith attempted a wild heave across the line to a length ball from Cummins, catching a faint edge off the bottom of the bat; the ball was caught by the Unicorns’ wicketkeeper, Josh Inglis. Although the umpire initially gave it not out, a timely review turns out to be the right decision for the Unicorns, sending Smith back to the pavilion for just one run off 3 balls.

Here is the video:

Also MLC 2024 [WATCH]: Rashid Khan plays a remarkable innovative shot for six in the TSK vs MINY Eliminator game

Washington Freedom in the finals of MLC 2024

Head, the standout performer and Player of the Match, played a scintillating innings, scoring 77 runs off just 44 balls. His knock included an astonishing ten fours and three sixes, showcasing his dominance and love for big occasions. Head’s explosive batters laid a solid foundation for Washington Freedom’s successful chase.

Equally impressive was the bowling display from Jansen, who took three crucial wickets in his four overs, further stifling the Unicorns’ batting lineup. Despite the efforts of Hasan Khan, the only batter from the San Francisco side to score significantly, with 57 runs off 36 balls, including six massive sixes, the Unicorns fell short.

The San Francisco Unicorns were bowled out for 145 in 19 overs, while Washington Freedom easily chased down the target, finishing at 149 for 3 in 15.3 overs, clinching the victory by seven wickets.

As Washington Freedom cruise to their first finals in the MLC 2024, the Unicorns will have another shot at redemption as they face the Texas Super Kings in the next qualifier.

title: Top 5 knocks in MLC 2024
body:
The 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) has been entertaining the fans from the last three weeks. There have been several performances with both bat and ball that have exhilarated the fans throughout the tournament.

There have been several batters who have ruled the bowlers in MLC 2024 and have been impressive with their batting, playing some top knocks in the tournament. Here is the list of top five knocks by the batters in MLC 2024.

Highest scores in MLC 2024

5. Jason Roy - 69(52) against Seattle Orcas

Playing for Los Angeles Knight Riders, Jason Roy scored 69 runs off 52 balls in a match against Seattle Orcas in Dallas on July 9th. His knock helped LAKR to post a total of 168 for 5 in their 20 overs. However, Ryan Rickelton’s 100 took the game away from LAKR as Seattle Orcas chased the target in 19.5 overs losing just one wicket.

4. Finn Allen - 77(30) against Seattle Orcas

Finn Allen’s fiery knock helped San Francisco to register a convincing victory against Seattle Orcas in Dallas on July 20th. Batting first, Seattle Orcas posted 152 runs for the loss of seven wickets. In reply, San Francisco had a fiery start to the chase as Finn Allen got out after scoring 77 runs off just 30 balls. SFU chased the target in just 14.2 overs, losing four wickets.

3. Ryan Rickelton - 89(52) against Los Angeles Knight Riders

Ryan Rickelton played a fighting knock of 89 runs off 52 balls for Seattle Orcas in their loss against Los Angeles Knight Riders in Dallas on July 17th. Rickelton’s knock helped Seattle to post 142 for 6. In reply, LAKR chased the target easily in 19.1 overs at the loss of six wickets.

2. Faf du Plessis - 100(58) against Washington Freedom

Texas Super Kings skipper, Faf du Plessis scored the first century of MLC 2024 in a match against Washington Freedom in Morrisville on July 8th. Batting first, TSK posted 203/5 with Du Plessis scoring 100 runs off 58 balls. However, the match washed out due to rain when Washington were 62 for no loss in four overs while chasing 204 runs.

1. Ryan Rickelton - 103(66) against Los Angeles Knight Riders

Playing for Seattle Orcas, Ryan Rickelton played the highest knock of MLC 2024 in match against Los Angeles Knight Riders in Dallas on July 9th. In reply to LAKR’s 168/5, Rickelton played a fighting knock of 103 off 66 balls as Seattle chased the target in 19.5 overs with nine wickets in hand.

title: Travis Head Joins Elite Club, Becomes the Second Australian to Hit Five Consecutive Fifties in T20s
body:
The USA cricket enthusiasts are enjoying another thrilling edition of the Major League cricket. After enjoying the thrilling T20 World Cup, they are witnessing some more exciting T20 cricket. As the ongoing season ends a few times, Washington Freedom player Travis Head grabbed the limelight with his excellence. He shined throughout the season. Head scored five consecutive half-centuries. With this exciting form, he has become the second Australian player to score five consecutive half-centuries in T20s.

Another Milestone for Head:

In Australian cricket, Travis Head is a gem. His aggressive batting is his biggest strength. Besides international cricket, he also rocked the MLC 2024 stage. He scored five consecutive half-centuries and became the only second Australian to touch the extraordinary milestone.

He scored his first half-century of this milestone against LA Knight Riders. While chasing a low total in that match, Head played a knock of 54 runs in 32 balls. He continued his form in the next match against MI New York by playing a knock of 54 runs. Against Texas Super Kings, he also scored his third half-century.

In their last group stage match against San Francisco Unicorns, he scored his fourth half-century and played a knock of 56 runs. He continued his legacy in the qualifier match against San Francisco Unicorns. While opening the innings, he played a crucial knock of unbeaten 77 runs. Depending on this knock, they registered a 7-wicket win.

Washington Freedom Qualified for the Finals:

Throughout the ongoing season of the MLC 2024, Washington Freedom played dominating cricket. After having an excellent group stage competition, they met San Francisco Unicorns in the qualifier match. After winning the match, Washington Freedom opted to bowl first.

While bowling in the first innings, the Freedom bowlers showcased their dominating side. Marco Jansen secured three crucial wickets after conceding 46 runs. Rachin Ravindra was excellent. He conceded only 11 runs and secured 4 wickets. Saurabh Netravalkar secured 2 wickets after conceding 23 runs.

After dominating them in the first innings, they continued it in the second innings also. While opening the innings along with Travis Head, Steve Smith was dismissed scoring only 1 run. They lost three wickets quickly. But Travis Head and Glenn Maxwell snatched the game.

Head played an unbeaten knock of 77 runs in 44 balls. Maxwell remained unbeaten on 54 runs in 23 balls. They achieved the target only in the 16th over and won the match by 7 wickets. With that dominating win, they qualified for the final match.

title: Not Rohit Sharma! Noor Ahmad picks Rashid Khan, Virat Kohli, and this Indian as most talented cricketers
body:
Afghanistan and Texas Super Kings spinner Noor Ahmad was part of a fun rapid-fire session ahead of the team's next game against Seattle Orcas in the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024. The spinner is having a decent time in the league with the ball.

Noor Ahmad has been playing a vital role for the Texas Super Kings in the ongoing Major League Cricket. Although he hasn't played all the games for the team, in whatever opportunities he has got in the tournament, he has been vital for the team.

Noor Ahmad in the last game against Washington Freedom stepped up big time for his team. The wrist-spinner picked three wickets in the game and helped his team with wickets at crucial junctures of the game at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

Noor Ahmad removed Travis Head (53), Glenn Maxwell (34) and Rachin Ravindra. He returned with the figures of 3/38 but his effort went in vain as Texas Super Kings lost to Washington Freedom. They failed to chase the target of 207 runs and lost the game by 42 runs. He would be extremely vital for his team going ahead in the tournament.

Noor Ahmad also was involved in a rapid-fire session. He expressed his desire to play with AB de Villiers and also named his Afghanistan National Cricket Team skipper Rashid Khan as his favourite player. He also named Rashid, Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill as talented players.

Here is how his rapid-fire session went:

Q: Who is the one cricketer from the past that you want to play with? A: AB de Villiers.

Q: Who is your current favorite cricketer? A: Rashid Khan.

Q: What are you currently watching?

A: I don't remember the name.

Q: Who according to you is the most talented cricketer you have ever seen? A: Rashid, Virat and Shubman.

Q: If you were stranded on an island, who is the one person you will call to rescue you and why?

A: Police.

Q: If you were to swap your career from a player to another sport, who would that be? A: That will be football. I know it won't be possible but Ronaldo

Just be good in your life, that's it - Noor Ahmad reveals best life advice

Noor Ahmad was also asked to share the best advice he has received. He stated that his parents and friends have told him to be good in life.

Q: Best life advice you have received and from whom? A: From many players, from my parents, from my brother. Just be good in your life, that's it.

He also revealed that he would want Aamir Khan to play the role of him in a movie.

Q: If you want an actor to play a role of you in a movie, who will that actor be? A: Aamir.

Q: Funniest thing you have heard in the crowd during a game? A: Many things but I don't remember.

title: SFU vs TSK Commentary: Major League Cricket 2024 Updates
body: 26 Jul, 9.39am After all those thrilling finishes in the Major League Cricket 2024, we are now down to the last two games to find out who will lift the title this time. Washington Freedom has already sealed a spot in the Final after winning the Qualifier against San Francisco Unicorns. The challenger though will be played between the winner of Eliminator, Texas Super Kings and the loser of the Qualifier, San Francisco Unicorns at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas. Both sides faced each other earlier in the tournament and it was Texas Super Kings who won that contest by 7 wickets. The contest between the Texas Super Kings and San Francisco Unicorns has every ingredient of being a cagey contest with both sides depending on their top order while the bowling is their mainstay. The skipper of Texas Super Kings, Faf du Plessis has led them from the front and sits on top of the run-getters chart and his partner Devon Conway also features in the top 5 run-getters of this edition. The worrying part for the Texas Super Kings is they rely heavily on their top order and the likes of Marcus Stoinis, Aaron Hardie, and the rest of the batting order are yet to deliver when it matters the most. The bowling has done well and the likes of Noor Ahmad, Zia-ul-Haq, Calvin Savage, Dwayne Bravo, and Marcus Stoinis have combined well to create a perfect mix of spin and pace. Their opponents on the other hand, San Francisco Unicorns do bat heavy at the top but do possess threatening batters in the middle order as well. Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and Sanjay Krishnamurthi form an explosive top three while players such as Josh Inglis and Sherfane Rutherford comprise a solid middle order. The bowling looks balanced too with Pat Cummins leading the bowling attack along with Haris Rauf, Carmi le Roux, and Juanoy Drysdale while Hassan Khan will look to trap the opposition batters with his left-arm spinners. With two sides equally capable of dismantling their opponents, this promises to be no less than a thriller.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Rachin Ravindra and Travis Head dazzle as Washington Freedom reach their first final
body:
Rachin Ravindra’s all-round bowling performance and Travis Head’s fifth straight fifty powered Washington Freedom to the final of the Major League Cricket 2024 season with a seven-wicket win over San Francisco Unicorns in the Qualifier at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Thursday.

Rachin Ravindra once again recorded career-best figures in T20 cricket, picking up 4/11 as Marco Jansen finished with 3/46 from four overs to bowl out the Unicorns for 145. Hassan Khan was the pick of the batters for SFU scoring 57 off 36 balls.

In reply, Head top-scored in the match with an unbeaten 77 off just 44 balls, his highest score this season, as we raced to 149/3 with 27 balls to spare. The Aussie opener hit 10 fours and three sixes during his knock, his fifth consecutive fifty in MLC 2024.

Glenn Maxwell also smashed 54 off just 23 balls to take us into our first final of the MLC. He smashed five sixes and four boundaries to complete a comprehensive win for us.

Bowling first, Jansen struck with the third ball of the innings to dismiss Finn Allen, caught safely by wicketkeeper Andries Gous. Saurabh Netravalkar was right on the money as ever, sending back Jake Fraser-McGurk after constantly frustrating him with dot balls. Jansen picked up another wicket off the last ball of the powerplay as SFU slid to 49/3. The spin pair of Ravindra and Glenn Maxwell kept things tight as only 26 runs came in the next six overs with SFU losing two more wickets.

After attaining some stability, the SFU innings suffered once again as Jansen accounted for Anderson to get his third dismissal of the night. The last five wickets fell for just 18 runs as they closed out in 145.

Chasing 146, Travis Head carted three sixes and two fours off Carmi le Roux as we got past the fifty-run mark at the end of the powerplay.

Head coasted to his half-century off just 28 balls in the 10th over as Maxwell shifted gears soon after with back-to-back sixes off Hassan. Maxwell put on a show as he took apart the SFU bowling attack with his power and panache reaching his fifty in only 22 balls. The Aussie scored 46 of his total runs in boundaries.

Maxwell and Head added an unbroken 85 runs in just 40 balls for the fourth wicket to make light work of the chase. Maxwell looked in a hurry as he closed the match in style with a four off pacer Haris Rauf. Hassan Khan picked up two wickets for the SFU.

With the win, we proceed to the final of MLC 2024 to be played at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas on Sunday.

Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns MLC 2024 brief scores: SFU 145/10 in 19 overs (Hassan Khan 57, Corey Anderson 26, Rachin Ravindra 4/11, Marco Jansen 3/46) vs WF 149/3 in 15.3 overs (Travis Head 77*, Glenn Maxwell 54*, Hassan Khan 2/32).

Washington Freedom won by seven wickets.

title: Texas Super Kings Triumph Over Seattle Orcas in Major League Cricket 2024
body:
In an exciting match at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, the Texas Super Kings, led by Calvin Savage, defeated the Seattle Orcas by 37 runs in the final league match of Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

Match Highlights

Despite a strong start by Quinton de Kock and Shehan Jayasuriya, the Seattle Orcas couldn’t chase down the target of 178 runs. The Texas Super Kings’ bowlers, including Ottneil Bartmann, Noor Ahmad, and Calvin Savage, played a crucial role in dismantling the Seattle batting lineup.

Seattle Orcas’ Run Chase

Seattle Orcas began their chase with a setback as Ryan Rickleton was dismissed for a duck on the first ball. Quinton de Kock and Shehan Jayasuriya tried to stabilize the innings, but both were dismissed by the seventh and ninth overs, respectively. Heinrich Klaasen and Matthew Bracewell couldn’t contribute much, and the team struggled to keep up with the required run rate.

Shubham Ranjane and Keemo Paul tried to keep the Orcas in the game, but their efforts were in vain as the team finished at 140/9. Ottneil Bartmann was the standout bowler for the Texas Super Kings, taking three wickets for just 20 runs.

Texas Super Kings’ Innings

Earlier, the Texas Super Kings had a shaky start, losing openers Devon Conway and Joshua Tromp early. However, Faf Du Plessis played a brilliant knock, scoring 39 runs off 17 balls. Calvin Savage was the star of the innings, remaining unbeaten with 45 runs off 27 balls, helping the team reach a total of 177/8.

Keemo Paul was the best bowler for the Seattle Orcas, taking two wickets for 18 runs.

Conclusion

With this victory, the Texas Super Kings secured their spot in the eliminator match against MI New York. The Seattle Orcas, on the other hand, ended their campaign with six losses and only one win.
